CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Economic Area (EEA), with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 03C14

TI_TEXT.P: Paquetes de software y sistemas de información
Pacchetti software e sistemi di informazione
Programinės įrangos paketai ir informacinės sistemos
Pakketti tas-softwer u sistemi ta' informazzjoni
Pacotes de software e sistemas de informação

TITLE.P: Invitation to a dialogue conference – The Future’s digital solutions for the child welfare service

SHORT_DESCR.P: Trondheim, Oslo, Bærum, Asker, Kristiansand, Stavanger, Bergen, Lørenskog and Fet municipalities, as well as KS (the municipalities´ organisation) and Bufdir (the Directorate of Children, Youth and Families), invite potential suppliers of digital systems within child welfare to a market dialogue.

TEXT.P: The market dialogue will build further on the market dialogue that was held in the concept phase of the project. A dialogue conference, one-to-one meetings between suppliers and one-to-one meetings between suppliers and the public authorities were held in February 2017.

The market dialogue is part of an early dialogue and interaction with the market/suppliers for involvement in the planning phase. This work will influence what will be requested from the municipalities as regards digital systems in the child welfare service in the coming years.

The market dialogue in the planning phase includes a dialogue conference with a focus on implementation strategy (the choices that set the frameworks for the further project, such as competition form, contract type, etc.). This dialogue conference will be held 22 November 2017.
In addition, a dialogue conference that focuses on needs will be held in January/February 2018. Further information will be given at a later date.

In order to ensure equal treatment, transparency and predictability in the process, this invitation is being announced on Doffin as a prior information notice. Participation in the dialogue conference and responses to this invitation will not bind any of the parties as regards the planned subsequent procurement.

The aim of the dialogue conference is to get input from suppliers on what kind of implementation strategy should be used in the future. Based on this open dialogue conference, suppliers are invited to come with ideas and proposals for the different areas of the implementation strategy. The aim is to get the best possible knowledge on feasibility and alternative systems that are available in the market.

One week after the dialogue conference we would like participants to send their input (maximum 5 pages), in which answers are given to a number of questions on the implementation strategy, which you will receive before the dialogue conference. See the chapter on Implementation Strategy above for examples of questions.
After the project has received the input, one-to-one meetings will be held approx. two weeks after the dialogue conference. These meetings will primarily be held via video.

The market dialogue will build further on the market dialogue that was held in the concept phase of the project. A dialogue conference, one-to-one meetings between suppliers and one-to-one meetings between suppliers and the public authorities were held in February 2017.

The market dialogue is part of an early dialogue and interaction with the market/suppliers for involvement in the planning phase. This work will influence what will be requested from the municipalities as regards digital systems in the child welfare service in the coming years.

The market dialogue in the planning phase includes a dialogue conference with a focus on implementation strategy (the choices that set the frameworks for the further project, such as competition form, contract type, etc.). This dialogue conference was held 22 November 2017.
In addition, a dialogue conference that focuses on needs will be held on 8 February 2018. More information about registering can be found in the documents.

In order to ensure equal treatment, transparency and predictability in the process, this invitation is being announced on Doffin as a prior information notice. Participation in the dialogue conference and responses to this invitation will not bind any of the parties as regards the planned subsequent procurement.

The aim of the dialogue conference is to get input from suppliers on what kind of implementation strategy should be used in the future. Based on this open dialogue conference, suppliers are invited to come with ideas and proposals for the different areas of the implementation strategy. The aim is to get the best possible knowledge on feasibility and alternative systems that are available in the market.

One week after the dialogue conference we would like participants to send their input (maximum 5 pages), in which answers are given to a number of questions on the implementation strategy, which you will receive before the dialogue conference. See the chapter on Implementation Strategy above for examples of questions.
After the project has received the input, one-to-one meetings will be held approx. two weeks after the dialogue conference. These meetings will primarily be held via video.

INFO_ADD.P: Information and registration for the market dialogue to be held on 8 February has been added to the documents.
